Container.Name: cryptomator-webdav
Container.Overview:
Cryptomator WebDAV allows you to serve a locally stored Cryptomator vault over WebDAV, allowing access through third party WebDav tools such as rclone, Mountain Duck, CyberDuck etc. Cryptomator Vault Password: The password for the vault can either be shared through the Cryptomator Vault Password variable, or can be stored in a local file called vault.pass which is manually shared in the container as '/vault.pass'
See the Cryptomator WebDAV github project for more details at https://github.com/greycubesgav/cryptomator-webdav More details about Cryptomator can be found at https://cryptomator.org

Config.Name: Cryptomator webDAV Port
Config.Description: Port the Cryptomator WebDAV share will be available at.

Config.Name: Cryptomator Vault Directory
Config.Description: The location of the local Cryptomator vault files.

Config.Name: Cryptomator Vault Password
Config.Description: The Cryptomator password for the vault. Note: is visible in docker env. Use password file for more secure option.

Config.Name: Or Cryptomator Vault Password File
Config.Description: Optionally set the location of a local file containing the Cryptomator vault password.

Config.Name: Optional: Signed Certificate
Config.Description: Optional: A fully signed cert with key embeded to be used by stunnel.

Config.Name: Cryptomator UID
Config.Description: User ID to run cryptomator-cli as

Config.Name: Cryptomator GID
Config.Description: Group ID to run cryptomator-cli as
